Crossfade::IGUI

Crossfade::IGUI Interface Reference

Interface a Crossfade-GUI class has to implement. More...

Inherited by Crossfade::gui_krypton.

Inheritance diagram for Crossfade::IGUI:

[legend]
List of all members.

Public Member Functions

void Show ()
 A GUI needs to have some kind of Show() function which tells the GUI, that it should attract the users attention.
void onMediaChanged ()
 Callback which is called by the Player, when the current media has changed, for example because it ended and the next one is playing now.
System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox getDrawingCanvas ()
 We need a PictureBox where we can draw nice pictures to.
System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox getVideoCanvas ()
 We need a second PictureBox for videos (we can't use the first one because DirectX does some nasty stuff to it after showing a video).
void setViewmode (Viewmode vm)
 We need to tell the form which kind of media is played at the moment - should the Playlist be shown, or the PictureBox for pictures, or the one for videos? The GUI knows about this, after we have called this function.
void p2p_DidRemoveService (NetServiceBrowser browser, NetService service, bool moreComing)
 This callback is called by the P2PDB whenever a service we discovered at some earlier time has disappeared.
void p2p_DidFindService (NetServiceBrowser browser, NetService service, bool moreComing)
 This callback is called by the P2PDB whenever a new service was discovered.
void p2p_DidResolveService (NetService service)
 This callback is called by the P2PDB whenever we finished resolving an IP for a given service.
void refreshPlayAndSmartlists ()
 Tells the GUI, that it should check for new playlists and smartlists in the MediaDB.

Detailed Description

Interface a Crossfade-GUI class has to implement.

Member Function Documentation

System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox Crossfade::IGUI::getDrawingCanvas (  ) 

We need a PictureBox where we can draw nice pictures to.

This function asks the GUI to return us one.

Returns:
The PictureBox where the picture is drawn to.

Implemented in Crossfade::gui_krypton.

System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox Crossfade::IGUI::getVideoCanvas (  ) 

We need a second PictureBox for videos (we can't use the first one because DirectX does some nasty stuff to it after showing a video).

Returns:
The PictureBox where the video is drawn to.

Implemented in Crossfade::gui_krypton.

void Crossfade::IGUI::setViewmode ( Viewmode  vm  ) 

We need to tell the form which kind of media is played at the moment - should the Playlist be shown, or the PictureBox for pictures, or the one for videos? The GUI knows about this, after we have called this function.

;)

Parameters:
vm The Viewmode the form should adapt to.

Implemented in Crossfade::gui_krypton.

void Crossfade::IGUI::p2p_DidRemoveService ( NetServiceBrowser  browser,
NetService  service,
bool  moreComing 
)

This callback is called by the P2PDB whenever a service we discovered at some earlier time has disappeared.

Parameters:
browser The NetServiceBrowser object which discovered the change
service The service which disappeared
moreComing A flag which tells the GUI if there are more calls to this function scheduled, so updating can be done at once

Implemented in Crossfade::gui_krypton.

void Crossfade::IGUI::p2p_DidFindService ( NetServiceBrowser  browser,
NetService  service,
bool  moreComing 
)

This callback is called by the P2PDB whenever a new service was discovered.

Parameters:
browser The NetServiceBrowser object which discovered the new service
service The new service
moreComing A flag which tells the GUI if there are more calls to this function scheduled, so updating can be done at once

Implemented in Crossfade::gui_krypton.

This callback is called by the P2PDB whenever we finished resolving an IP for a given service.

Parameters:
service The service which was resolved
